windows.name: BGB
windows.logo_svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 64 64' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='64' height='64' fill='#2a2a2a' rx='8'/><rect x='8' y='8' width='48' height='48' fill='#4a4a4a' rx='4'/><rect x='12' y='12' width='40' height='28' fill='#9db500'/><rect x='16' y='44' width='32' height='8' fill='#333'/><circle cx='20' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='28' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='36' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='44' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/></svg>
windows.installation:
1. Download BGB from bgb.bircd.org
2. Extract the archive to your desired location
3. Run bgb.exe
4. No additional installation needed
windows.configuration:
1. Open BGB
2. File > Open and select your Game Boy ROM
3. The emulator supports most GB ROMs out of the box
4. Configure controls in Settings > Input

macos.name: BGB
macos.logo_svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 64 64' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='64' height='64' fill='#2a2a2a' rx='8'/><rect x='8' y='8' width='48' height='48' fill='#4a4a4a' rx='4'/><rect x='12' y='12' width='40' height='28' fill='#9db500'/><rect x='16' y='44' width='32' height='8' fill='#333'/><circle cx='20' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='28' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='36' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='44' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/></svg>
macos.installation:
1. Download BGB for Mac
2. Extract and place in Applications
3. Launch BGB from Applications
4. May need to allow in Security settings
macos.configuration:
1. Open BGB
2. File > Open and select your Game Boy ROM
3. Configure controls in Settings > Input
4. Full Game Boy support

linux.name: Gambatte
linux.logo_svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 64 64' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='64' height='64' fill='#3d3d3d' rx='8'/><rect x='8' y='8' width='48' height='48' fill='#5a5a5a' rx='4'/><rect x='12' y='12' width='40' height='28' fill='#7cb342'/><rect x='16' y='44' width='32' height='8' fill='#2d2d2d'/><rect x='20' y='48' width='4' height='2' fill='#555'/><rect x='28' y='48' width='4' height='2' fill='#555'/><rect x='36' y='48' width='4' height='2' fill='#555'/></svg>
linux.installation:
1. Install via package manager: sudo apt-get install gambatte-qt
2. Or compile from source from GitHub
3. No additional setup required
linux.configuration:
1. Open Gambatte
2. File > Open ROM
3. Select your Game Boy ROM
4. Configure controls via menu

windows.name: Sameboy
windows.logo_svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 64 64' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='64' height='64' fill='#2a2a2a' rx='8'/><rect x='8' y='8' width='48' height='48' fill='#4a4a4a' rx='4'/><rect x='12' y='12' width='40' height='28' fill='#00ff00'/><rect x='16' y='44' width='32' height='8' fill='#333'/><circle cx='20' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='28' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='36' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='44' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/></svg>
windows.installation:
1. Download Sameboy from https://sameboy.github.io/
2. Extract the executable
3. Run sameboy.exe
4. No installation needed
windows.configuration:
1. Open Sameboy
2. File > Open ROM and select your GBC game
3. Full color support with accurate emulation
4. Configure controls in Preferences > Controls

windows.name: BGB
windows.logo_svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 64 64' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='64' height='64' fill='#2a2a2a' rx='8'/><rect x='8' y='8' width='48' height='48' fill='#4a4a4a' rx='4'/><rect x='12' y='12' width='40' height='28' fill='#00ff00'/><rect x='16' y='44' width='32' height='8' fill='#333'/><circle cx='20' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='28' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='36' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='44' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/></svg>
windows.installation:
1. Download BGB from bgb.bircd.org
2. Extract the archive
3. Run bgb.exe
4. Full GBC support included
windows.configuration:
1. Open BGB
2. File > Open and select your GBC ROM
3. Automatically detects GBC mode
4. Configure controls in Settings > Input

macos.name: Sameboy
macos.logo_svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 64 64' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='64' height='64' fill='#2a2a2a' rx='8'/><rect x='8' y='8' width='48' height='48' fill='#4a4a4a' rx='4'/><rect x='12' y='12' width='40' height='28' fill='#00ff00'/><rect x='16' y='44' width='32' height='8' fill='#333'/><circle cx='20' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='28' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='36' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='44' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/></svg>
macos.installation:
1. Download Sameboy for macOS from https://sameboy.github.io/
2. Extract and move to Applications
3. Launch from Applications
4. May need to allow in Security settings
macos.configuration:
1. Open Sameboy
2. File > Open ROM
3. Select your Game Boy Color ROM
4. Enjoy accurate GBC emulation

linux.name: Sameboy
linux.logo_svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 64 64' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='64' height='64' fill='#2a2a2a' rx='8'/><rect x='8' y='8' width='48' height='48' fill='#4a4a4a' rx='4'/><rect x='12' y='12' width='40' height='28' fill='#00ff00'/><rect x='16' y='44' width='32' height='8' fill='#333'/><circle cx='20' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='28' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='36' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/><circle cx='44' cy='48' r='2' fill='#666'/></svg>
linux.installation:
1. Build from source: git clone https://github.com/LIJI32/SameBoy.git
2. cd SameBoy && make
3. Run ./sameboy
4. Or install via package manager if available
linux.configuration:
1. Open Sameboy
2. File > Open ROM
3. Load your GBC game
4. Configure controls as needed

windows.name: mGBA
windows.logo_svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 64 64' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='64' height='64' fill='#4a4a8a' rx='8'/><rect x='8' y='8' width='48' height='48' fill='#6a6aaa' rx='4'/><rect x='12' y='12' width='40' height='30' fill='#9090cc'/><rect x='18' y='46' width='28' height='6' fill='#3a3a6a'/></svg>
windows.installation:
1. Download mGBA from mgba.io
2. Run the installer or extract the portable version
3. Launch mGBA
4. No additional setup needed
windows.configuration:
1. Open mGBA
2. File > Load ROM
3. Select your GBA game
4. Configure controls in Tools > Settings

macos.name: mGBA
macos.logo_svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 64 64' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='64' height='64' fill='#4a4a8a' rx='8'/><rect x='8' y='8' width='48' height='48' fill='#6a6aaa' rx='4'/><rect x='12' y='12' width='40' height='30' fill='#9090cc'/><rect x='18' y='46' width='28' height='6' fill='#3a3a6a'/></svg>
macos.installation:
1. Install from Homebrew: brew install mgba
2. Or download DMG from mgba.io
3. Launch mGBA from Applications
4. Full GBA support
macos.configuration:
1. Open mGBA
2. File > Load ROM
3. Select your GBA game
4. Configure controls in Tools > Settings

linux.name: mGBA
linux.logo_svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 64 64' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='64' height='64' fill='#4a4a8a' rx='8'/><rect x='8' y='8' width='48' height='48' fill='#6a6aaa' rx='4'/><rect x='12' y='12' width='40' height='30' fill='#9090cc'/><rect x='18' y='46' width='28' height='6' fill='#3a3a6a'/></svg>
linux.installation:

2. Or compile from source
3. Available on most Linux distributions
4. No additional setup
linux.configuration:
1. Open mGBA
2. File > Load ROM
3. Select your GBA ROM
4. Configure controls in Tools > Settings

android.name: mGBA
android.logo_svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 64 64' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='64' height='64' fill='#4a4a8a' rx='8'/><rect x='8' y='8' width='48' height='48' fill='#6a6aaa' rx='4'/><rect x='12' y='12' width='40' height='30' fill='#9090cc'/><rect x='18' y='46' width='28' height='6' fill='#3a3a6a'/></svg>
android.installation:
1. Download mGBA from Google Play Store
2. Or download APK from mgba.io
3. Install the app
4. Grant storage permissions
android.configuration:
1. Open mGBA
2. Tap the folder icon to browse ROMs
3. Select your GBA game
4. Configure controls in app settings

windows.name: Snes9x
windows.logo_svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 64 64' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='64' height='64' fill='#6a1a1a' rx='8'/><rect x='8' y='8' width='48' height='48' fill='#8a3a3a' rx='4'/><rect x='12' y='12' width='40' height='30' fill='#c85a5a'/></svg>

2. Run the installer or extract portable version
3. Launch Snes9x
4. No additional installation needed

2. File > Open ROM
3. Select your SNES game
4. Configure joypad in Inputs > Joypad Configuration

macos.name: Snes9x
macos.logo_svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 64 64' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='64' height='64' fill='#6a1a1a' rx='8'/><rect x='8' y='8' width='48' height='48' fill='#8a3a3a' rx='4'/><rect x='12' y='12' width='40' height='30' fill='#c85a5a'/></svg>

3. Move to Applications
4. May need to allow in Security settings
macos.configuration:
1. Open Snes9x
2. File > Open ROM
3. Select your SNES game
4. Configure controls in Inputs > Joypad Configuration

3. Select your SNES game
4. Configure controls via menu

android.name: Snes9x EX+
android.logo_svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 64 64' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='64' height='64' fill='#6a1a1a' rx='8'/><rect x='8' y='8' width='48' height='48' fill='#8a3a3a' rx='4'/><rect x='12' y='12' width='40' height='30' fill='#c85a5a'/></svg>
android.installation:
1. Download from Google Play Store
2. Or download APK from alternative sources
3. Install the app
4. Grant storage permissions

windows.name: Project64
windows.logo_svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 64 64' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='64' height='64' fill='#8a3a1a' rx='8'/><rect x='8' y='8' width='48' height='48' fill='#ba6a3a' rx='4'/><rect x='12' y='12' width='40' height='32' fill='#e8a060'/></svg>
windows.installation:
1. Download Project64 from pj64-emu.com
2. Run the installer
3. Select installation folder
4. Install complete
windows.configuration:
1. Launch Project64
2. File > Open ROM
3. Select your N64 game
4. Configure controller in Options > Configure Controller

macos.name: Mupen64Plus
macos.logo_svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 64 64' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='64' height='64' fill='#5a3a1a' rx='8'/><rect x='8' y='8' width='48' height='48' fill='#8a5a2a' rx='4'/><rect x='12' y='12' width='40' height='32' fill='#c8906a'/></svg>
macos.installation:
1. Install from Homebrew: brew install mupen64plus
2. Or build from source
3. May require additional plugins
4. Configure emulator paths
macos.configuration:
1. Open Mupen64Plus
2. File > Open ROM
3. Select your N64 game
4. Configure input in Settings > Input Devices

linux.name: Mupen64Plus
linux.logo_svg: <svg viewBox='0 0 64 64' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='64' height='64' fill='#5a3a1a' rx='8'/><rect x='8' y='8' width='48' height='48' fill='#8a5a2a' rx='4'/><rect x='12' y='12' width='40' height='32' fill='#c8906a'/></svg>
linux.installation:
1. Install via package manager: sudo apt-get install mupen64plus
2. Install GUI: sudo apt-get install mupen64plus-ui-console
3. May require additional video/audio plugins
4. No additional setup
linux.configuration:
1. Open Mupen64Plus
2. File > Open ROM
3. Select your N64 game
4. Configure controls in Settings > Input Devices

1. Download DuckStation from website or build from source
2. Extract and run the application
3. Available as AppImage on most Linux distributions
4. No additional setup required
linux.configuration:
1. Open DuckStation
2. Add game directory in Settings
3. Select your PSX game
4. Configure controls in Settings > Input
